DCL Public API: Byte-Order Conversion

Send comments on this topic.
Byte-order conversion operations.

Summary

DclCopyAndReverse   Copies the source data to the destination buffer, reversing the bytes along the way.
DclCopyEmulated64ToLittleEndian   This function copies an emulated 64-bit type to a buffer and places the results in little- endian byte order.
DclCopyLittleEndianToEmulated64   This function copies little-endian source data and converts it to an emulated 64-bit type.
DclInPlaceEmulated64ToLittleEndian   This function converts an emulated 64-bit type to little- endian byte order.
DclInPlaceLittleEndianToEmulated64   This function converts a little-endian data-type to an emulated 64-bit type.
DclReverseInPlace   Reverses the byte order of the data pointed to by pData.

DclCopyAndReverse

void DclCopyAndReverse(
    void *pDest,
    const void *pSrc,
    D_UINT16 uLength)
Copies the source data to the destination buffer, reversing the bytes along the way.

Parameters

pDest - A pointer into the destination buffer
pSrc - A pointer into the source data
uLength - The number of bytes to process

Return Value

None.

DclCopyEmulated64ToLittleEndian

void DclCopyEmulated64ToLittleEndian(
    D_BUFFER *pBuff,
    const D_UINT64 *pullSrc)
This function copies an emulated 64-bit type to a buffer and places the results in little- endian byte order.

Parameters

pBuff - A pointer to the destination buffer
pullSrc - A pointer to the source emulated 64-bit type.

Return Value

None.

DclCopyLittleEndianToEmulated64

void DclCopyLittleEndianToEmulated64(
    void *pDestEmul64,
    const D_BUFFER *pBuff)
This function copies little-endian source data and converts it to an emulated 64-bit type.

Parameters

pDestEmul64 - A pointer to the destination emulated 64-bit type.
pBuff - A pointer to the little-endian source data

Return Value

None

DclInPlaceEmulated64ToLittleEndian

void DclInPlaceEmulated64ToLittleEndian( void *pData)
This function converts an emulated 64-bit type to little- endian byte order.

Parameters

pData - A pointer into the data to process

Return Value

None.

DclInPlaceLittleEndianToEmulated64

void DclInPlaceLittleEndianToEmulated64( void *pData)
This function converts a little-endian data-type to an emulated 64-bit type.

Parameters

pData - A pointer into the data to process

Return Value

None.

DclReverseInPlace

void DclReverseInPlace(
    void *pData,
    D_UINT16 uLength)
Reverses the byte order of the data pointed to by pData.

Parameters

pData - A pointer into the data to reverse
uLength - The number of bytes to reverse

Return Value

None.
